committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Water, Power and Offshore Energy Resources
Subcommittee on Panama Canal and Outer Continental Shelf

official_title: To require the completion of studies identified by the Pacific Northwest Outer Continetal Shelf Task Force, and agreed to by the Secretary of the Interior and the President, regarding areas of the outer continetal shelf off the coast of Oregon and Washington.

summary.text: Pacific Northwest Coast Protection Act - Imposes a moratorium on certain outer continental shelf leasing or pre-leasing activities off the coast of Oregon and Washington until after the year 2000. Prohibits preparation of a related draft environmental impact statement until after the Pacific Northwest Outer Continental Shelf Task Force completes and analyzes scientific and environmental studies necessary to enable the Secretary of the Interior to make decisions with respect to oil and gas leasing activities in such areas. Requires the Secretary to use the results of such studies as a basis for all decisions relating to oil and gas leasing activities on the outer continental shelf off the coast of Oregon or Washington. Requires the Secretary to use the recommendations of the Task Force as a basis for all decisions for periods after the year 2000 in any leasing program under the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act.

titles.title: To require the completion of studies identified by the Pacific Northwest Outer Continetal Shelf Task Force, and agreed to by the Secretary of the Interior and the President, regarding areas of the outer continetal shelf off the coast of Oregon and Washington.
